attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Further to the comments made in the submitted petition started by Palmedia, the petitioner urges the govt to provide DFES funded financial support for web sites designed for educational purposes - educate, educate, educate (remember ?) at least to cover costs (such as internet access. At present this is independently undertaken and funded by professional teachers, without employer backing, though many are linked to universities and educational establishments. For example, the author's work (available for viewing at www.kidsstories.wordpress. com) was designed to meet gaps in basic skills materials provision, took about 4 years and probably about £4000 - does the UK govt know, care or intend on doing anything about the reliance of the public sector on charitable status and the good will of individuals ?

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
